question: You have received a letter from your bank, asking you to acknowledge receipt of a new bank card. However, the card was missing from the envelope.Write a letter to the bank's head office. In your letter:explain why you are writingexpress concern about the missing cardask them what they intend to do
text: I am writing in relation to your letter about my credit card acknowledgement. Please note, when I had received the envelope yesterday, it was missing and I was about to report the same.

I thought it would be helpful to inform you at the earliest stage to avoid any misuse of the credit. The envelope from the bank was in my letterbox, it was not handed over to me directly by the courier company. It was clearly stated in your email, that it should be only handed over when a valid ID is shown. But unfortunately, it could not happen.
I am worried that the stolen card might get misused by the person, who has stolen it before any action is taken by the bank.

I request you to immediately block this card and investigate, how the courier company could be so careless to leave confidential documents in letterboxes, even when it is instructed to hand them over to the recipient. Also, send me a new card and please make sure this time it is handed over to me directly.
Looking forward to hearing from you at earliest.
